text:
Computer and Programming (ARC6113)
Credit hours: 3
Pre-requisite: None
Summary: Introduction to computing and C programming covering algorithms, control structures, arrays, pointers, functions, structures, and file operations.

Micro-controllers and Micro-processors (ARC6123)
Credit hours: 3
Pre-requisite: None
Summary: Practical introduction to microcontrollers and microprocessors including 8051 architecture, assembly programming, peripherals, and interfacing.

Basic Electronics (ARE6113)
Credit hours: 3
Pre-requisite: None
Summary: Fundamentals of semiconductor devices, diodes, BJTs, biasing techniques, and amplifier circuits with lab practice.

Digital Design (ARE6123)
Credit hours: 3
Pre-requisite: None
Summary: Digital logic fundamentals including number systems, Boolean algebra, combinational and sequential logic, and digital system design.

Analog Electronics (ARE6133)
Credit hours: 3
Pre-requisite: None
Summary: Design and analysis of analog circuits using operational amplifiers, filters, oscillators, and voltage regulators.

Electrical Circuits (ARL6113)
Credit hours: 3
Pre-requisite: None
Summary: Circuit theory covering DC/AC analysis, nodal and mesh methods, transient analysis, and laboratory verification.

Engineering Calculus (ARM6113)
Credit hours: 3
Pre-requisite: None
Summary: Calculus, sequences and series, Fourier series, complex numbers, vector algebra, and probability for engineering applications.

Differential Equations (ARM6123)
Credit hours: 3
Pre-requisite: ARM6113
Summary: Ordinary and partial differential equations, partial differentiation, and integral transforms with engineering applications.

Rapid Modelling (MID6113)
Credit hours: 3
Pre-requisite: None
Summary: Hands-on prototyping using traditional and digital fabrication methods including 3D printing and model making.

Industrial Training (ART6116)
Credit hours: 6
Pre-requisite: Completed 60 credit hours
Summary: Industry placement to gain real-world engineering experience assessed through logbook, supervisor evaluation, and report.

Fundamental of Computer System (AAC6113)
Credit hours: 3
Pre-requisite: None
Summary: Computer hardware fundamentals including CPU, memory, I/O systems, instruction sets, and high-performance architectures.

Data Communications and Networking (AAC6123)
Credit hours: 3
Pre-requisite: None
Summary: Networking fundamentals covering TCP/IP, OSI models, transmission media, LAN technologies, and protocols.

AI Governance and Ethics (AAC6133)
Credit hours: 3
Pre-requisite: None
Summary: Responsible AI development, governance frameworks, ethical risk assessment, and AI ethics principles.

Artificial Intelligence Fundamentals (AAC6153)
Credit hours: 3
Pre-requisite: None
Summary: Core AI principles including intelligent agents, search, evolutionary algorithms, and basic machine learning.

Fundamental of Computer Science (AAC6164)
Credit hours: 4
Pre-requisite: None
Summary: Digital logic, operating systems, and programming fundamentals to support advanced computing topics.

Database Systems (AAC6173)
Credit hours: 3
Pre-requisite: None
Summary: Database design, SQL, normalization, transaction management, and modern database system trends.

Data Acquisition, Engineering and Visualisation (AAC6193)
Credit hours: 3
Pre-requisite: None
Summary: Data collection, preprocessing, feature engineering, and visualization techniques for AI systems.

Algorithms and Data Structures for AI (AAC6213)
Credit hours: 3
Pre-requisite: None
Summary: Core data structures and algorithms including lists, trees, graphs, searching, and sorting for AI applications.

metadata.course_name: Algorithms and Data Structures for AI

text:
Data Analytics Fundamentals (AAC6223)
Credit hours: 3
Pre-requisite: None
Summary: Introduction to data analytics concepts, techniques, tools, and applications in AI and decision support.

Natural Language Processing (AAC6233)
Credit hours: 3
Pre-requisite: None
Summary: Natural language processing techniques including text preprocessing, language models, parsing, and applications.

Applied Electronics and Practical Techniques (AAE6113)
Credit hours: 3
Pre-requisite: None
Summary: Electronic components, circuit design, laboratory tools, and PCB design with hands-on practice.

Machine Vision and Image Processing (AAE6134)
Credit hours: 4
Pre-requisite: None
Summary: Image processing and machine vision techniques including segmentation, recognition, and vision hardware.

Embedded Systems for AI (AAE6143)
Credit hours: 3
Pre-requisite: None
Summary: Design and development of embedded systems with AI integration using modern microcontrollers.

Robotics and Perceptions (AAE6153)
Credit hours: 3
Pre-requisite: None
Summary: Robotic systems, sensing, kinematics, control, and probabilistic robot software concepts.

Artificial Intelligence in Autonomous Systems (AAE6163)
Credit hours: 3
Pre-requisite: AAT6123
Summary: AI techniques for autonomous systems including perception, planning, sensor fusion, and control.

IoT Systems and Applications (AAE6173)
Credit hours: 3
Pre-requisite: None
Summary: Design and implementation of IoT systems including edge devices, connectivity, and cloud integration.

Probability and Statistics (AAM6113)
Credit hours: 3
Pre-requisite: None
Summary: Probability theory, random variables, distributions, and statistical inference for AI applications.

Project (AAP6118)
Credit hours: 8
Pre-requisite: Completed 60 credit hours
Summary: Capstone project involving analysis, design, implementation, evaluation, and presentation.

Industrial Training (AAP6126)
Credit hours: 6
Pre-requisite: Completed 60 credit hours
Summary: Industry attachment focused on professional practice, ethics, and real-world problem solving.
